poem:
"Indifference in Numbers"

With each word spoken by Sunak,
the empire of indifference expands.
A chess game with invisible players -
Positions shifted, strategies blunted,
by a politics that doesn't rouse a cheer.
In this spectacle, tedious as drizzle,
A strange solace blossoms for Starmer,
Finding harvest in an unsuspecting field,
That holds no promise,
yet yields.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "When Rishi Sunak speaks, the nation shrugs. There’s no coming back from that | Rafael Behr Rishi Sunak is not a deep-cover agent of the Labour party, but politics might not look very different if the prime minister were on a secret mission to make life easier for Keir Starmer. To achieve this feat, special operative Sunak would occupy positions expected of a Conservative leader, but in a way that minimised public enthusiasm and maximised". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
